tit.cmt: 京都府 を追加しました。

sen.j: 木津駅（きづえき）は、京都府木津川市木津池田116-2にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Kizu Station (located at 116-2 Kizu Ikeda, Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture) is a railway station of West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Kizu Station, located at 116-2 Kizu Ikeda, Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway station of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Kizu Station, located at 116-2 Kizu Ikeda, Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway station of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

sen.j: 4方向に線路がつながり、2つの路線の起点駅という要衝であるが、利用客はさほど多くはない。
sen.e: Although its location is quite important as tracks extend toward 4 directions and trains of 2 lines depart from this station, the number of passengers is not so big.
Although its location is quite important, as the tracks extend toward in directions and the trains of two lines depart from this station, the number of passengers isn't very large.
Although its location is quite important, as the tracks extend toward in four directions and the trains of two lines depart from this station, the number of passengers isn't very large.

sen.j: ICOCA・Jスルー利用可能駅（相互利用対象ICカードはICOCAの項を参照）。
sen.e: ICOCA・J-through is available at this station (concerning IC cards that are mutually usable, refer to the column of ICOCA).
ICOCA・J-through is available at this station (refer to the column on ICOCA for information concerning IC cards that are mutually usable).
ICOCA and J-through cards can be used at this station (refer to the column on ICOCA for information concerning IC cards that are mutually usable).
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）
sen.e: West Japan Railway Company (JR West)
West Japan Railway Company (JR West)
West Japan Railway Company (JR West)

sen.j: 関西本線（大和路線）
sen.e: Kansai Main Line (Yamatoji Line)
Kansai Main Line (Yamatoji Line)
Kansai Main Line (Yamatoji Line)

sen.j: 奈良線 - 起点
sen.e: (JR) Nara Line- the station of origin
(JR) Nara Line - the station of origin
(JR) Nara Line - the station of origin

sen.j: 片町線 - 起点
sen.e: Katamachi Line - the station of origin
Katamachi Line - the station of origin
Katamachi Line - the station of origin

sen.j: 奈良線と片町線は当駅が路線上の終着駅だが、奈良線列車は運転系統上奈良駅を始終着（京都行きの一部にJR難波駅・王寺駅始発あり）とするため、当駅始終着の列車はない。
sen.e: Although the official terminal station of both (JR) Nara Line and Katamachi Line is this station, no trains of (JR) Nara Line depart from or arrive at this station in practice as they depart from or arrive at (JR) Nara Station due to operation route (some trains bound for Kyoto depart from JR-Nanba Station・Oji Station).

Although this is the official terminal station of both (JR) Nara Line and Katamachi Line, no trains of (JR) Nara Line depart from or arrive at this station in practice, as they depart from or arrive at (JR) Nara Station due to the route of operation (i.e., some trains bound for Kyoto depart from JR-Nanba Station・Oji Station).

Although this is the official terminal station of both Nara Line and Katamachi Line, no trains of Nara Line depart from or arrive at this station in practice, as they depart from or arrive at Nara Station due to the route of operation (i.e., some trains bound for Kyoto depart from JR-Nanba Station and Oji Station).

sen.j: 一方、片町線の列車は早朝・深夜に奈良直通列車があるのみで、殆どの列車が当駅を始終着とする。
sen.e: On the other hand, this station is the terminal station of most trains of Katamachi Line, except for some trains which run directly into Nara Station early in the morning and late at night.
On the other hand, this is the terminal station for most trains on the Katamachi Line, except for some that run directly into Nara Station early in the morning and late at night.
On the other hand, this is the terminal station for most trains on the Katamachi Line, except for some that run directly into Nara Station early in the morning and late at night.

sen.j: プラットホーム配置と形状2面4線のホームを持つ地上駅（橋上駅舎）である。
sen.e: This station is a ground station (station building on the bridge) that has 2 platforms for 4 tracks.
This station is a ground station (station building on the bridge) having two platforms for four tracks.
This station is a ground station (station building on the bridge) having two platforms for four tracks.

sen.j: 現在の橋上駅舎は2007年4月1日に供用開始された。
sen.e: Current station building on the bridge commenced operation as of April 1, 2007.
The current station building on the bridge began operating as of April 1, 2007.
The current station building on the bridge began operating as of April 1, 2007.

sen.j: 独特の流線型を持つ外観は、木津川の流れをイメージしたという。
sen.e: Its unique streamlined exterior is said to have been designed with having the image of the flow of Kizu-gawa River in mind.
Its unique streamlined exterior is said to have been designed with the image of the flow of the Kizu-gawa River in mind.
Its unique streamlined exterior is said to have been designed with the image of the flow of the Kizu-gawa River in mind.

sen.j: また木材の流通で栄えた町（旧木津町）の歴史を表すため、随所に木目調のデザインを取り入れている。
sen.e: It also adopts wood grain design everywhere in order to symbolize the history of the town (old Kizu-cho) which once strived thanks to the distribution of lumber.
It also employs wood-grain design throughout, in order to symbolize the history of the town (old Kizu-cho) that once thrived here, thanks to the distribution of lumber.
It also employs wood-grain design throughout, in order to symbolize the history of the town (old Kizu-cho) that once thrived here, thanks to the distribution of lumber.

sen.j: 旧駅舎は大正時代に建てられたという平屋で、ホームへは線路下の通路（線路が築堤上のため通路は地平レベル）で連絡していた。
sen.e: The old station building was an one-storied building constructed in Taisho Period and was linked to platforms by the passage running under tracks (as tracks were located on the bank, the passage was constructed on the ground level).

The old station building was a one-story structure built in the Taisho period, and was linked to platforms by a passage running under the tracks (as tracks were located on the bank, the passage was constructed at ground level).

The old station building was a one-story structure built in the Taisho period, and was linked to platforms by a passage running under the tracks (as tracks were located on the bank, the passage was constructed at ground level).

sen.j: また以前は、現在の1番のりばの西側に2線、両ホームの間に2線と東側に留置線（6本）が敷設されていた。
sen.e: In the past, there used to be 2 tracks on the west side of current track 1, 2 tracks between 2 platforms and storage tracks (6 tracks) on the east side.
In the past, there were two tracks on the west side of the current track 1, two tracks between two platforms and storage tracks (six tracks) on the east side.
In the past, there were two tracks on the west side of the current Platform 1, two tracks between two platforms and storage tracks (six tracks) on the east side.

sen.j: 駅構内の自動放送は、橋上化以前は「○番線」とアナウンスされていたが、現在はJR西日本で一般的な「○番のりば」の表現に更新されている。
sen.e: Before the station building was constructed on the bridge, the term of "○ ban-sen (line ○)" had been used in the automated guidance announcement in the station but instead of that, " ○ ban noriba (track ○)", which is commonly used at stations of JR West, is currently being used.

Before the station building was constructed on the bridge, the term "○ ban-sen (line ○)" had been used in the automated guidance announcement in the station, but instead of that, "○ ban noriba (track ○)," which is commonly used at stations of JR West, is currently used.

Before the station building was constructed on the bridge, the term 'X ban-sen (Platform X)' had been used in the automated guidance announcement in the station, but instead of that, 'X ban noriba (Platform X),' which is commonly used at stations of JR West, is currently used.
sen.cmt: "→ ' としました。○ →Ｘ としました。「No.番線」の表記を統一

sen.j: 奈良方面へ向かう列車（下り列車）については、大和路線加茂方面からは3・4番のりばの両方に入線できるが、奈良線京都方面からは3番線にしか入線できない。
sen.e: Out of trains bound for Nara (down train), trains coming from Kamo Station via the Yamatoji Line can use both track 3 and 4 but those coming from Kyoto via the Nara Line can use track 3 only.

Out of the trains bound for Nara (down train), a train coming from Kamo Station via the Yamatoji Line could either track 3 or track 4, but a train coming from Kyoto via the Nara Line can only use track 3.

Out of the trains bound for Nara (outbound train), a train coming from Kamo Station via the Yamatoji Line could enter Platform 3 or Platform 4, but a train coming from Kyoto via the Nara Line can only use Platform 3.
sen.cmt: 下り→outbound としました。スペルを修正しました。「No.番線」の表記を統一

sen.j: そのため、両路線の列車が同時に入線する場合は、大和路線の列車が待避線である4番のりばに入る。
sen.e: When trains of both lines arrive at the station simultaneously, therefore, trains of the Yamatojo Line use track 4, which is usually a sidetrack.
When trains of both lines arrive at the station simultaneously, trains of the Yamatojo Line use track 4, which is usually a sidetrack.
When trains of both lines arrive at the station simultaneously, trains of the Yamatoji Line use Platform 4, which is usually a sidetrack.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。「No.番線」の表記を統一

sen.j: また、大和路快速が当駅で奈良線を待避することもある。
sen.e: From time to time, Yamatoji-Kaisoku (Rapid Service) waits for the passing of trains of the Nara Line at this station.
From time to time, Yamatoji-Kaisoku (Rapid Service) waits for the passing of trains on the Nara Line at this station.
From time to time, Yamatoji Rapid Service waits for the passing of trains on the Nara Line at this station.
sen.cmt: Yamatoji Rapid Service としました。

sen.j: なお、当駅を始発とする下りの「やまとじライナー」は4番のりばから発車する。
sen.e: Yamatoji Liner, whose station of origin is this station, depart from track 4.
The Yamatoji Liner, whose station of origin is this station, departs from track 4.
The Yamatoji Liner, whose station of origin is this station, departs from Platform 4.

sen.j: 片町線（学研都市線）は西側の1番のりばにしか線路がつながっておらず、その1番のりばのみを使用する。
sen.e: As the track of Katamachi Line(Gakkentoshi Line) connects only to track 1 on the west side of the station, trains of this line use only track 1.
Because the track of Katamachi Line (Gakkentoshi Line) connects only to track 1 on the west side of the station, trains of this line use only track 1.
Because the track of Katamachi Line (Gakkentoshi Line) connects only to Platform 1 on the west side of the station, trains of this line use only Platform 1.

sen.j: 1番のりばは、京都方面（奈良線）の列車の待避線としての役割も持っているが、現在のダイヤでは1番のりばでの待避列車はない。
sen.e: Although track 1 has the role of being the sidetrack for trains bound for Kyoto (Nara Line), no trains wait for the passing of other trains at track 1 under current schedule.
Although track 1 serves as the sidetrack for trains bound for Kyoto (Nara Line), under the current schedule no trains wait for the passing of other trains at track 1.
Although Platform 1 serves as the sidetrack for trains bound for Kyoto (Nara Line), under the current schedule no trains wait for the passing of other trains at Platform 1.

sen.j: ただ、緊急時に備えての錆取り列車のためか、1日1本のみ奈良線の上り列車が1番のりばに入線する。
sen.e: However, an up train of the Nara Line use track 1 once a day seemingly for the purpose of removing the rust.
However, an up train of the Nara Line uses track 1 once a day, seemingly for the purpose of removing the rust.
However, an inbound train of the Nara Line uses Platform 1 once a day, seemingly for the purpose of removing the rust.
sen.cmt: 上り→inbound としました。「No.番線」の表記を統一

sen.j: 駅の東側には田畑が広がる。
sen.e: Agricultural fields extend in the area of east side of the station.
Agricultural fields extend over the area east of the station.
Agricultural fields extend over the area east of the station.

sen.j: 商店や住宅があるのはほとんど西側である。
sen.e: Most of shops and houses are located in the area of west side of the station.
Most shops and houses are located in the area on the west side of the station.
Most shops and houses are located in the area on the west side of the station.

sen.j: 現在、駅西側で「木津駅前土地区画整理事業（木津川市施行）」が、今回開設される駅東口方面約1.5kmでは木津中央地区土地区画整理事業（都市機構施行）が実施されている。
sen.e: Currently, "Land readjustment project of the area in front of Kizu Station (promoted by Kizugawa City)" is underway on the west side of the station and "Land readjustment project of central district of Kizu (promoted by the Urban Renaissance Agency)" is also underway in the area 1.5 km away from the east entrance of the station which is expected to open soon.

Currently, "Land readjustment project of the area in front of Kizu Station (promoted by Kizugawa City)" is underway on the west side of the station and "Land Readjustment Project of the Central District of Kizu (Promoted by the Urban Renaissance Agency)" is also underway in the area 1.5 km from the east entrance of the station, which is expected to open soon.

Currently, 'Land readjustment project of the area in front of Kizu Station (promoted by Kizugawa City)' is underway on the west side of the station and 'Land Readjustment Project of the Central District of Kizu (Promoted by the Urban Renaissance Agency)' is also underway in the area 1.5 km from the east exit of the station, which is expected to open soon.
sen.cmt: "→ ' としました。entrance →exit としました。

sen.j: 橋上駅舎化に伴って東口に駅前交通広場が2007年7月2日に開設され、奈良交通路線バスが木津南地区（州見台・梅見台）から乗り入れを開始している。
sen.e: In the wake of the completion of the station building on the bridge, the traffic square was constructed in front of of the east entrance of the station on July 2, 2007 and buses operated by Nara Kotsu Bus Lines Co., Ltd. commenced running into there from Kizuminami district (Kunimidai・Umemidai).

In the wake of the completion of the station building on the bridge, the construction of a traffic square was completed in front of the east entrance of the station on July 2, 2007 and buses operated by Nara Kotsu Bus Lines Co., Ltd., began entering from the Kizuminami district (Kunimidai・Umemidai).

In the wake of the completion of the station building on the bridge, the construction of a traffic square was completed in front of the east exit of the station on July 2, 2007 and buses operated by Nara Kotsu Bus Lines Co., Ltd., began entering from the Kizuminami district (Kunimidai and Umemidai).
sen.cmt: ・ → and としました。entrance →exit としました。

sen.j: 2006年度の1日平均の乗車人員は3,118人である（京都府統計書）
sen.e: Average number of passengers a day in 2006 was 3,118 (based on the statistics compiled by Kyoto Prefectural Government).
The average number of passengers a day in 2006 was 3,118 (based on statistics compiled by the Kyoto Prefectural Government).
The average number of passengers a day in fiscal year 2006 was 3,118 (based on statistics compiled by the Kyoto Prefectural Government).

sen.j: 1896年（明治29年）3月13日 - 奈良鉄道の木津駅（鉄道駅一般駅）が開業。
sen.e: March 13, 1896 - Nara Railway's Kizu Station commenced operation (general railway station).
March 13, 1896 - Nara Railway's Kizu Station began operating (as a general railway station).
March 13, 1896: Nara Railway's Kizu Station began operating (as a general railway station).

sen.j: 1898年（明治31年）6月4日 - 関西鉄道の新木津駅が開業、約600m離れるが木津駅と連絡駅になる。
sen.e: June 4, 1898 - Kansei Railway Company's Shin-Kizu Station commenced operation and it became the transit station to Kizu Station though it is around 600m away from Kizu Station.
June 4, 1898 - Kansei Railway Company's Shin-Kizu Station commenced operations and became the transit station to Kizu Station, though it's approximately 600 meters away from Kizu Station.
June 4, 1898: Kansei Railway Company's Shin-Kizu Station commenced operations and became the transit station to Kizu Station, although it's approximately 600 meters away from Kizu Station.
sen.cmt: - → : としました。"though"→"although"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1898年（明治31年）9月16日 - 関西鉄道の木津駅が開業（新木津～木津間が延伸）。
sen.e: September 16, 1898 - Kansei Railway Company's Kizu Station commenced operation (Shin-Kizu ～ Kizu section of the line was extended)
September 16, 1898 - Kansei Railway Company's Kizu Station became operational (the Shin-Kizu ～ Kizu section of the line was extended).
September 16, 1898: Kansei Railway Company's Kizu Station became operational (the section between Shin-Kizu and Kizu of the line was extended).

sen.j: 1898年（明治31年）11月18日 - 新木津～加茂間が開業し、名阪間の新ルートとなる網島駅（1913年廃止）～名古屋駅間が全通。
sen.e: November 18, 1898 - Shin-Kizu～Kamo section came into operation and as a result, Amijima Station (abolished in 1913)～Nagoya Station section, which was the new line connecting Nagoya and Osaka, came into operation in whole.

November 18, 1898 - The Shin-Kizu～Kamo section went into operation, and as a result the Amijima Station (abolished in 1913)～Nagoya Station section, which was the new line connecting Nagoya and Osaka, came into operation as a whole.

November 18, 1898: The section between Shin-Kizu and Kamo stations went into operation, and as a result the section between Amijima Station (abolished in 1913) and Nagoya Station, which was the new line connecting Nagoya and Osaka, came into operation as a whole.

sen.j: 1901年（明治34年）1月18日 - 新木津～木津間が休止。
sen.e: January 18, 1901 - The operation of Shin-Kizu～Kizu section was suspended.
January 18, 1901 - The Shin-Kizu～Kizu section operations were suspended.
January 18, 1901: The section between Shin-Kizu and Kizu operations were suspended.

sen.j: 1905年（明治38年）2月7日 - 関西鉄道が奈良鉄道を合併。
sen.e: February 7, 1905 - Kansei Railway Company merged Nara railway.
February 7, 1905 - The Kansei Railway Company merged with the Nara railway.
February 7, 1905: The Kansei Railway Company merged with the Nara Railway.

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）8月21日 - 加茂～木津間が開業し、現在の関西本線ルート完成。
sen.e: August 21, 1907 - Kamo～Kizu section came into operation and current route of the Kansai Main Line was completed.
August 21, 1907 - The Kamo～Kizu section came into operation and the current route of the Kansai Main Line was completed.
August 21, 1907: The section between Kamo and Kizu came into operation and the current route of the Kansai Main Line was completed.

sen.j: 新木津～木津間再開。
sen.e: The operation of Shin-Kizu～Kizu section restarted.
The Shin-Kizu～Kizu section began operating again.
The section between Shin-Kizu and Kizu began operating again.

sen.j: 新木津駅を休止。
sen.e: The operation of Shin-Kizu Station was suspended.
The operations of Shin-Kizu Station were suspended.
The operations of Shin-Kizu Station were suspended.

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）10月1日 - 関西鉄道が鉄道国有法。
sen.e: October 1, 1907 - Kansei Railway Company was nationalized.
October 1, 1907 - The Kansei Railway Company was nationalized.
October 1, 1907: The Kansei Railway Company was nationalized.

sen.j: 1909年（明治42年）10月12日 - 鉄道路線の名称制定により、関西本線所属となる。
sen.e: October 12, 1909 - In the wake of the establishment of the line name, this station became the station of the Kansai Main Line.
October 12, 1909 - In the wake of the establishment of the line name, this became a station of the Kansai Main Line.
October 12, 1909: In the wake of the establishment of the line name, this became a station of the Kansai Main Line.

sen.j: 1911年（明治44年）8月30日 - 休止中の新木津駅が廃止。
sen.e: August 30, 1911 - Shin-Kizu Station, whose operation had been suspended, was abolished.
August 30, 1911 - Shin-Kizu Station, whose operations had been suspended, was abolished.
August 30, 1911: Shin-Kizu Station, whose operations had been suspended, was abolished.

sen.j: 1984年（昭和59年）2月1日 - 貨物営業廃止（鉄道駅旅客駅となる）。
sen.e: February 1, 1984 - Freight service was abolished (this station became passengers railway station).
February 1, 1984 - Freight service was abolished (this facility became a passenger railway station).
February 1, 1984: Freight service was abolished (this facility became a passenger railway station).

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化により、JR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1987 - This station has become the station of JR West thanks to the division and privatization of JNR.
April 1, 1987 - This station became a facility of JR West, thanks to the division and privatization of JNR.
April 1, 1987: This station became a facility of JR West, due to the division and privatization of JNR.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）4月1日 - 橋上駅舎供用開始。
sen.e: April 1, 2007 - The station building on the bridge commenced operation.
April 1, 2007 - The station building on the bridge commenced operations.
April 1, 2007: The station building on the bridge commenced operations.

sen.j: 2008年（平成20年）2月8日 - 旧駅舎のホーム連絡通路を再利用した東西連絡通路供用開始。
sen.e: February 8, 2008 - The access way linking east and west side of the station, which was constructed making full use of the passage of old station building that linked to platforms, was placed in service.

February 8, 2008 - The access way linking the east and west sides of the station, which was constructed by making full use of the passage of the old station building that linked to platforms, was placed in service.

February 8, 2008: The access way linking the east and west sides of the station, which was constructed by making full use of the passage of the old station building that linked to platforms, was placed in service.

tit.e: Information concerning the position of the Station
